Ethical clearance was obtained for the study from the
Ethics Committee of the Faculty of Health Sciences,
University of the Free State (ECUFS No92/2013), and
the study was authorised by the Free State Department
of Health. All participants completed a consent letter
prior to participating in this research.

and did not provide adequate resources to prevent
205; 87.2 %) had been screened for TB at work.
TB screening for patients entails being asked a series of
questions focusing on: cough for more than 2 weeks,
weight loss, fever and night sweats. A positive response to
one or more of these questions necessitates TB testing.
